Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGirl55
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. The staff was attentive and pleasant. The room was very clean and it was nice to have a fridge and microwave. Beds were very good and it was nice and quiet. They have a breakfast that was good. Pretty typical fare but they did have some protein options of boiled eggs so that helped. At first I thought this might be a bit too far south, but we had no problem accessing everything we wanted to do in San Diego. In fact, I think it helped being south of town a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel and very nice people”
Reviews.Author: GracieLee'smom
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. It included a shuttle service into Mexico and back. I think many people stay here who are going to medical treatments in Tijuana. The other people we met at breakfast were very nice. The breakfast was fine. There is a Carl's Junior and a CoCo's right next door. Nice pastries for breakfast, cereal, toast and good coffee. I would definitely stay here again. There is a huge outlet mall nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel, Not so nice continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wilsha
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. Price pretty good @ $76. Bed comfortable. Loved having a microwave and mini fridge in the room. Free cable and wi-fi. What I had problems with was the continental breakfast -- the apples had been refrigerated and the boiled eggs as well. Who knows how old the eggs were, as the yolks definitely did not appear to be fresh. The waffles however were ok, freshly made. Also, the room was quite noisy with a worker power washing the building in the morning, however that's just when we were there so it shouldn't be a problem for most travelers. The air conditioner was loud too. I think I would stay again, but just skip the breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent, met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: djsunshine99
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient, next to Highway 5. You reach the San Diego zoo in 20 minutes. Southern beaches are easily reachable within a 10 minute drive. A few fast food restaurants along the H-5 service road. Rooms are of a good size. The hotel is well maintained. Decent breakfast. Staff was nice or politely ignored me. But never rude. Less than basic personal care products. I guess you have to ask for it, which I do not consider normal. This BW met my expectations without exceeding them in any ways. It was my first time in San Diego. For my next visit, I will look for an hotel in the area called 'Hotel circle' (north-western corner of H5 and H8) I think it would be the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler00
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, basic rooms. Accomodating staff. We stayed here because of needing to travel across the border for medical reasons. This room was reasonably priced and a great value, we really appreciated the cleanliness. Quite adequet rooms. Not alot of frills but it exceeded our expectations. I have stayed in another hotel nearby that was similarly priced and would never return. This place is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “As far as Best Westerns go this is a plus!!”
Reviews.Author: onereview
Reviews.Content: I was offered a job marketing and so before I accept the position I thought I would come see and stay at the hotel. It is right off the freeway on your way to Mexico, it isn't far from downtown and the rooms are clean and nicely remodeled, and a plus in my book NO dirty BEDSPREADS, also a bit of interesting info. They not only have a trash can in the rooms but a RECYCLE bin as well in the ROOM. Free Breakfast can't beat that! oh and if you want to go across the border for lets say have some discreet surgery, they have a shuttle to an from the Clinics. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: doximom2
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by accident and wouldn't stay anywhere else when I'm in the San Diego area. It is exceptional for the price. The rooms are large, bright and cheery and comfortable. The beds are great (and I don't usually sleep well in a 'strange' bed). The place is overall spotless, the amenities are excellent, the location is perfect....what else can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: revwarfan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this motel many times. We stay here while we do medical treatment across the border. The grounds and property are always being maintained, and the rooms have recently been remodelled. They are basic rooms, but are very good value and clean. Pool area and hot tub is great for kids. Not much to do in the immediate area, although the Coronado Drive in Theatre and Imperial Beach are closeby. We felt safe in the motel, no break ins or thefts. There are restaurants nearby if you don't have a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: alpacaRick
Reviews.Content: Check in was nice, lady very helpful. No continental breakfast. Lady at desk in morning very rude, changed my rate because I needed shuttle to TJ. (It was mentioned at reservation and check in) Room smelled musty, no coffee on first day

Reviews.Title: “Not great but nice”
Reviews.Author: paulcartman
Reviews.Content: Great location, loads of eating places near by, very close to the freeway, plenty of parking and the rate was quite cheap. The bed was quite comfy but the shower was real bad. it would go from warm to freezing cold like every min. was not happy about that. Everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap prices and good service, BUT... smells like raw sewage!”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during the San Diego Comic-Con last weekend. Here's a breakdown of this hotel: Positives: -The prices were very affordable (~ $89/night). -The housekeeping service was prompt and very thorough. -They had a pool, but we never used it. -There was plenty of parking. -The air conditioning was FREEZING cold (thank goodness!) -Our room also had a microwave, a mini-fridge, a blow dryer, and a coffee maker. -Free cable TV! Negatives: -Although we arrived at around 12:30 and the room was already made up, the front desk told us it would be "about an hour" until we could move in. (We moved in anyways.) -There was a perpetual smell of raw sewage in the room; especially in the bathroom. Nothing was leaking and we couldn't track it down to a source, but the smell never went away. -The two beds weren't firm enough, and the pillows were too thick. -There was no free shampoo or conditioner; they want you to use a single, unlabeled, wall-mounted soap pump in the shower (like at an auto body shop!) -The cereal dispenser constantly jammed at the continental breakfast. The maid had to use tongs as a work-around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Clean Rooms - Basic!!!”
Reviews.Author: PiscesCoupleNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for my pre-op/post-op stay for surgery I had in TJ. My room was CLEAN and the bed was very comfortable (they just got new pillow top mattresses). The maid service was EXCELLENT!!! The ladies at the front desk were very rude and ignorant - although when making my reservations they were very nice on the phone. Just very aloof in person. It could be the culture (everyone that works there is Mexican). I only had a problem once when I asked them to call me a cab for an appointment I had and after waiting around for 30 minutes they remembered they "forgot" to call. They could have cared less about me getting to any appointment on time and laughed at the fact they forgot to call my cab - they were amused. The shuttle service to/from clinics were nice to have although they have "limited" shuttle service. Once again - the bathrooms were clean - the rooms were clean - exactly what you would expect from a Best Western property. Basic. If you are having minor surgery and would like to stay in the US - its a good place to recover. The neighborhood is not "bad" as some people stated - I stayed there alone and never once felt uneasy. I would only recommend this hotel if you are having medical procedures in TJ - due to the shuttle service.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Americana Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 815 West San Ysidro Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92173-1827
